CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Density functional theory ( DFT ) calculations was carried out to probe the molecular and electronic properties of the PffBB-n polymer by means of B3LYP / 6-311+(d,p) as a basis set in a vacuum using the repeating conjugated units of the polymer backbone in which all of the alkyl substitutions were replaced by ethyl groups to reduce the calculation time.

Let's think step by step.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the updated table with the valid "Material Name" entities:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| B3LYP |
| 6-311+(d,p) |
| PffBB-n |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Density functional theory ( DFT ) calculations was carried out to probe the molecular and electronic properties of the PffBB-n polymer by means of B3LYP / 6-311+(d,p) as a basis set in a vacuum using the repeating conjugated units of the polymer backbone in which all of the alkyl substitutions were replaced by ethyl groups to reduce the calculation time.

Let's think step by step.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the updated table with only the entities that clearly refer to material properties:

| Property Name |
| --- |
| B3LYP |
| 6-311+(d,p) |

These two entities are the basis set and the exchange-correlation functional used in the density functional theory (DFT) calculations, which are both related to the material properties of the PffBB-n polymer.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Density functional theory ( DFT ) calculations was carried out to probe the molecular and electronic properties of the PffBB-n polymer by means of B3LYP / 6-311+(d,p) as a basis set in a vacuum using the repeating conjugated units of the polymer backbone in which all of the alkyl substitutions were replaced by ethyl groups to reduce the calculation time.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| B3LYP |
| 6-311+(d,p) |
| ethyl |

Explanation:

* B3LYP and 6-311+(d,p) are both property values referring to specific levels of theory and basis sets used in DFT calculations.
* ethyl is a property value referring to the substitution of alkyl groups by ethyl groups in the polymer backbone.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Valid entities:

| Property Value |
| --- |
| B3LYP |
| 6-311+(d,p) |

Explanation:

* B3LYP and 6-311+(d,p) are both property values referring to specific levels of theory and basis sets used in DFT calculations, which are clearly related to the value of material properties.
* ethyl is not a property value, but rather a chemical group that is used to modify the polymer backbone. It does not directly refer to the value of a material property and therefore should not be included in the table.
